result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermel Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Decision and Order denying request for sentence credit, signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Pedro A. Colon, Br. 18, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request for sentence credit.

Defendant Jermel Harris appears in court by video with Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jermel Harris in custody.  Catelin Ringersma for Irene Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Restitution Hearing.  Arguments heard.  The victim did not appear.  The Court set Restitution at ZERO.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
Due to the prison being unavailable on October 22, 2015 to have Defendant appear by video, the matter is adjourned to November 16, 2015 at 1:30pm.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Jermel Harris not in court, in custody.  irene Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Restitution Hearing.  The Court currently is in trial and the facility could not arrange a video conference later in the afternoon.  Matter was adjourned to October 22, 2015 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
received and filed.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Jermel Harris not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Restutition Hearing.  The Court is currently in trial and had to adjourn this matter.  Matter is adjourned to October 14, 2015 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Jermel Harris not in court, in custody at Dodge Correctional Institution.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for a vido-conference restitution hearing. Dodge Correctional was not available for video conference on this date. Case is adjourned in branch 30.  Restitution hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Jermel Harris in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jermel Harris in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED TO A MISDEMEANOR):  Defendant sentenced to serve 9 MONTHS at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION (will be served in prison), consecutive to any other sentence defendant is currently serving. 
Credit for ZERO days time served.

OTHER COURT ORDERS (AS TO COUNT 1):
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid within 90 days from today's date.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Court "WAIVED" the DNA surcharge based upon the fact that the defendant was revoked because of the offense referenced in this case.

Appeal rights given. 

ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Case adjourned to 09-08-2015 at 9:00 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Restitution Hearing.

**Clerk arranged for defendant to appear via video conference on the next court date.

FILED:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Jermel Harris in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jermel Harris in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Jury Trial today, however, the parties have now reached an agreement.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 AMENDED to:  Misdemeanor Battery [a Class A MISDEMEANOR], contrary to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 940.19(1).

AS TO COUNT 1 (AMENDED TO A MISDEMEANOR):    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

FILED, Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form and Addendum.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Jermel Harris not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Final pre-trial.  Case heard off the record due to Branch 02 being in jury trial.  Parties still in contest posture.  Case remains set for Jury Trial on 7-01-15 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 02.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Jermel Harris not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Plea Hearing today.
Parties have not yet reached an agreement.
Parties request a Jury Trial date.
Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 05-28-2015 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 07-01-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Jermel Harris not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Projected Plea Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 04-21-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Projected Plea Hearing.

Certification of PRELIM. HRG. transcript commencing 3-4-15 received and filed. (9 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to STEPHEN SARGANT, PUBLIC DEFENDER, 819 N. 6TH.

Defendant Jermel Harris in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Jermel Harris in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Troy Mason-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guiltys.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with David H.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jermel Harris in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  
Defendant Jermel Harris in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
